00023 // This object manages the memory of the simulated MIPS processor for
00024 // the Nachos kernel.
00025 class MMU {
00026 public:
00027   MMU();
00028   
00029   ~MMU();
00030   
00031   bool ReadMem(int addr, int size, int* value, bool is_instruction,
00032                int *fetch_time);
00035 
00036   bool WriteMem(int addr, int size, int value, int *write_time);
00040   
00041   ExceptionType Translate(int virtAddr, int* physAddr,
00042                           int size, bool writing);
00048   
00049   // NOTE: the hardware translation of virtual addresses in the user program
00050   // to physical addresses (relative to the beginning of "mainMemory")
00051   // can be controlled by both :
00052   //    - a traditional linear page table (or dual level page table)
00053   //    - a software-loaded translation lookaside buffer (tlb) -- a cache of 
00054   //      mappings of virtual page #'s to physical page #'s
00055   TranslationTable *translationTable; 
00056 };
